name: Defunct NFL Teams Online Trivia | American Football | 15 Questions

questions.text: New York City has had a few NFL teams over the years, one of which was based on Staten Island. What was the nickname of this team?
questions.explanation:
Stapletons.

	The Stapletons played in the NFL from 1929 until 1932, their home stadium being Thompson's Stadium in Stapleton.  Their best season was in 1930 when they finished 5-5-2. Hall of Fame halfback Ken Strong began his pro carrer with the Stapletons before joining the New York Giants in 1933.

questions.text: Which team are often regarded as the predecessors of the Philadelphia Eagles?
questions.explanation:
Frankford Yellow Jackets.

	The Yellow Jackets were based in the Philadelphia suburb of Frankford from 1924 until 1931, winning the league championship in 1926. The franchise was bought by Bert Bell and Lud Wray who created a new team, the Philadelphia Eagles. The Eagles are regarded as a separate team from the Yellow Jackets by the NFL. However, they did wear the same yellow and blue colors as their predecessors for a throwback game vs Detroit in 2007.

questions.text: Which "West Coast" team existed for only one season in 1926, and actually played all of their "home" games in Chicago?
questions.explanation:
Los Angeles Buccaneers.

	The Buccaneers team was stocked mainly by players from Californian colleges, which was their only connection with L.A. They finished with a 6-3-1 record in their only season in the league. The other three teams offered as possible answers never existed.

questions.text: Which team no longer in existence, were the very first champions of the NFL  in 1920?
questions.explanation:
Akron Pros.

	The Pros were an NFL franchise from 1920 until 1926, changing their nickname to the Indians in their final season. They won the very first APFA/NFL title with an 8-0-3 record. Hall of Famer Fritz Pollard was a former coach of the Pros, becoming the first African-American head coach in NFL history in the process.

questions.text: The Jeffersons were an NFL team from which city in New York State?
questions.explanation:
Rochester.

	The Rochester Jeffersons existed from 1920 until 1925, winning six games in their first season, two in their second, and none at all in their last four years as NFL members. They were the only team in NFL history to forfeit a game, vs the Washington Senators in 1921.

questions.text: The city of Columbus, Ohio, is normally associated, football-wise, with the Ohio State Buckeyes, but in 1920 there was a pro team from that city which took part in the very first NFL game. What nickname did they go by?
questions.explanation:
Panhandles.

	The Panhandles were originally formed in 1901, and were charter members of the APFA/NFL in 1920. They played the Dayton Triangles in the very first NFL game. The club was disbanded and reconstituted as the Columbus Tigers in 1923, before folding after the 1926 season.

questions.text: Before the Detroit Lions ever existed, the Motor City had a number of NFL franchises. Which of the following was not one of them?
questions.explanation:
Badgers.

	The Badgers were actually based in Milwaukee from 1922 until 1926. Detroit had four NFL teams in the 1920s; the Heralds in 1920, the Tigers in 1921, the Panthers in 1925/26, and the Wolverines in 1928.  Detroit finally got a permanent NFL franchise in 1934 when the Spartans moved from Portsmouth and became the Lions.

questions.text: The smallest town to ever host an NFL franchise is LaRue, Ohio. Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Oorang Indians.

	Named after the Oorang Dog Kennels, the Indians were NFL members in 1922/23, playing all but one of their games on the road. The team was composed entirely of Native Americans, and is synonymous with Olympic athlete Jim Thorpe who played at running back for them.

questions.text: Which team were deprived of the 1925 NFL title after being suspended for playing the Notre Dame All-Stars against league regulations?
questions.explanation:
Pottsville Maroons.

	The Maroons were based in Pottsville, Pennsylvania, from 1925 until 1928, when they moved to Boston and were renamed the Bulldogs. The 1925 NFL championship was controversially awarded to the Chicago Cardinals despite the fact that the Maroons defeated them in what was regarded as a title decider late in the season.  Pottsville played an exhibition game vs the Notre Dame All-Stars in Philadelphia on the same day as Frankford were playing a regular season game in the same city, and the NFL responded by barring them from the right to be declared champions.

questions.text: THe NFL expanded to a 32 team competition when the Houston Texans joined in 2002. Which team in 1928, was the last team outside of those 32 franchises to win the NFL championship?
questions.explanation:
Providence Steam Roller.

	Coached by Hall of Famer Jimmy Conzelman, the Steam Roller won the 1928 title with an 8-1-2 record. The team played their last season in 1931 before folding due to financial difficulties.

questions.text: The last team to cease operations, prior to the formation of the AFL in 1960, were the Dallas Texans in 1952. Which 2 cities had this team played in before their solitary season in Texas?
questions.explanation:
Boston and New York.

	This franchise was known as the Boston Yanks from 1944 until 1948, the New York Bulldogs/Yanks from 1949 until 1951, then the Dallas Texans in 1952. This team was unrelated to the AFL Dallas Texans of the early 1960s.

questions.text: Which early NFL powerhouse won back-to-back NFL titles in 1922-23, going undefeated in 21 games from 1921-23?
questions.explanation:
Canton Bulldogs.

	The Bulldogs' most famous player was Jim Thorpe, who also coached them in the 1920 season. The team was moved to Cleveland in 1924 and won another title there, before moving back to Canton the following year.

questions.text: The Brecks were an NFL franchise based in which city?
questions.explanation:
Louisville.

	The Louisville Brecks existed from 1921 until 1923, and in that timespan won only one game. Their stadium burned down in 1923, ending the story of pro football in the Kentucky city. A later team known as the Louisville Colonels existed for one season in 1926, but played all of their "home" games in Chicago.

questions.text: Which team that existed from 1920 until 1929, was based in Dayton, Ohio?
questions.explanation:
Triangles.

	The Triangles took their name from their stadium, Triangle Park. The very first APFA/NFL game took place there in 1920, with the home team defeating the Columbus Panhandles 14-0. Dayton's only winning record was achieved in that first season when they finished 5-2-2. In 1930, they moved to Brooklyn and were renamed the Dodgers.

questions.text: Which former member of the All-American Football Conference was admitted to the NFL in 1950, but folded after a single season?
questions.explanation:
Baltimore Colts.

	The Colts only won one game in their sole NFL season before folding due to financial difficulties. This team was unrelated to the later Baltimore/Indianapolis Colts franchise which began play in 1953.
